summary:
A qualified lawyer, experienced in program, project and people coordination and management. My expertise in supporting, developing and leading people, programs and projects is predominantly within the not for profit sector, specifically in the migration, human rights and international development contexts.

I have significant experience in monitoring, evaluation and learning as well as in training and workshop facilitation. I enjoy strategic planning and developing policy in consultative environments and offer a proven track record of managing high stress and workload pressure.

[{'company': {'id': 74376, 'name': 'Dorcas', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFYuNT_uoCzqg/company-logo_400_400/0/1614611356913?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=10aaxJtMAHgucPsqzRC8ZUtX4I88VTmbY-71GXFxcR8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/dorcas-nederland/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Almere, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Dorcas', 'description': "Dorcas works with people in need, their communities and society in the areas of humanitarian assistance, nexus and development in three regions: Africa, the Middle East and Eastern Europe.

Responsible for advising and facilitating MEAL activities across all regions. Key responsibilities include MEAL advice and facilitation, developing and formalising MEAL within Dorcas and developing and delivering MEAL Training for (inter)national employees. 

Key achievements include co-developing Dorcas’ Results Framework which outlines the organisation’s goals and associated indicators for measuring Dorcas' impact through all its projects and programmes.", 'title': 'Facilitator/Advisor: Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability & Learning (MEAL) ', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2787289, 'name': 'Interplast Australia & New Zealand', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEo5F87GDWT2A/company-logo_400_400/0/1567665421770?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=VwoOSPVgffgYvl2uAE0nY0oLpRf7yLVvXnW51M6Ke6o', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/interplast-australia-&-new-zealand/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Melbourne, Australia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Interplast Australia & New Zealand', 'description': "Interplast is a not-for-profit organisation that provides free surgical and allied health treatment for patients and training for local medical staff in the Asia Pacific region.

Responsible for Interplast programs in seven (7) countries across Asia.  Responsibilities include program/project management, stakeholder management, monitoring and evaluation, coordination of logistics, budget development and oversight as well as the development of Memorandum of Understanding’s (MOUs) with foreign Ministries of Health and in-country partners.
  
Key achievements include appointment as Interplast's Child Protection Officer, Member of Interplast's Monitoring & Evaluation Working Group and evaluating Interplast's Sri Lanka program.", 'title': 'Program Coordinator, Asia', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 301942, 'name': 'Australian Red Cross', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D560BAQFncGyrjbRNeA/company-logo_400_400/0/1687830892836?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=AdAbvqbqgrK7DL9auQTPtRYZ3RI13QOYcFa6mx-tnwE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/australian-red-cross/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Melbourne, Australia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Australian Red Cross', 'description': 'Australian Red Cross is a humanitarian and advocacy organisation that works with the most vulnerable communities in Australia and internationally. 

Working within the Australian Volunteers for International Development (AVID) Program, I was part of a team which attracted, engaged and supported Volunteers across the Asia Pacific region. In this role I was also involved in co-facilitating pre-departure training sessions, drafting position papers and learning notes.', 'title': 'International Volunteer Partner', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Melbourne, Australia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Australian Red Cross', 'description': 'Management of a National team to deliver, monitor & evaluate the Community Migration Programs (CMP). The Community Migration Programs is a nationwide program which provided health, housing, income and psycho-social support to asylum seekers living in the Australian community. In this role I provided day to day support, direction and leadership to the National team, established, implemented and coordinated monitoring, evaluation & learning practices, delivered training, facilitated workshops including focus group discussions with clients.

Key achievements include two (2) short term acting back-fill positions as National Program Coordinator of the combined program, Community Assistance Support & Asylum Seeker Assistance Scheme and selected to undertake a Casework secondment to the Australian Red Cross Perth Office.', 'title': 'National Team Leader: Monitoring, Evaluation & Learning', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Melbourne, Australia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'Australian Red Cross', 'description': 'Coordination of the nationwide Community Assistance Support (CAS) program through supporting and leading a large team of both direct and non-direct reports. The CAS Program provided health, income, housing and intensive psycho-social support to highly vulnerable asylum seekers. This role primarily involved people, program and project management, contract and financial management, advocacy and stakeholder engagement. I also delivered training, facilitated workshops and presented to public interest groups.

Key achievements include appointment as media spokesperson during a mass client transit at Melbourne’s International Airport and being part of a senior leadership group which lead the multi-million dollar expansion of the CAS program to transition asylum seekers from immigration detention centers to reside in the Australian community whilst they awaited a decision on their visa.', 'title': 'National Program Coordinator', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Melbourne, Australia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'Australian Red Cross', 'description': 'The role involved providing state and territory counterparts procedural and policy advice, program development, training and report writing.

My key achievements include being selected to undertake a secondment to the Community Detention Program to assist in their program expansion and development of papers which resulted in securing additional services for vulnerable clients.', 'title': 'National Program Officer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 3203138, 'name': 'Asylum Seeker Resource Centre', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGM0GMsKp0Svw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519889591637?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=M_4FqtQnFT4mLPo36tqSMeUjhPTRtMvmBAa65u0kx1Q', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/asylum-seeker-resource-centre/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Melbourne', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'Asylum Seeker Resource Centre', 'description': "Australia's largest asylum seeker advocacy, aid and health organisation promoting and protecting the human rights of asylum seekers.

Interviewed clients and provided legal advice to asylum seekers and other migrants, wrote statutory declarations, attended immigration resolution proceedings before the Department of Immigration and the Refugee Review Tribunal (RRT), undertook legal research and trained and supervised new volunteer legal representatives.

As a volunteer lawyer, I successfully secured protection visas for many of my clients and assisted with the preparation of a case before the Refugee Review Tribunal which successfully resulted in a protection visa later being granted.", 'title': 'Volunteer Lawyer - Wednesday Night Legal Service', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 564665, 'name': 'Department of Justice and Regulation, Victoria, Australia', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFXzJsVjr7gMg/company-logo_400_400/0/1571194060735?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=W_57fOmYEdBv5VDihERDZq9WWEp-DkesOrb7z1dJeAk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/department-of-justice-victoria/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Melbourne, Australia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'Department of Justice and Community Safety, Victoria', 'description': "VCAT's Human Rights Division deals with matters relating to discrimination, racial and religious vilification, involuntary mental health treatment, health and information privacy, disability, guardianship and administration. 

Initially a 15 week placement as part of my Practical Legal Training, I thereafter secured a role. My key responsibilities included preparing files for the proceedings, supervising document disclosure requests, bench clerking, conducting legal research, providing procedural advice,  witness protection, liaising with parties, drafting Tribunal correspondence and staff training.", 'title': 'Legal Intern & Administrative Officer - Human Rights Division', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Self-arranged independent visit', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Thai/Burma Border', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'Self-arranged independent visit', 'description': 'Self-arranged independent visit to a refugee camp (Mae La Temporary Shelter) on the Thai/Burma Border. Whilst at the refugee camp I met with detainees, visited the hospital, orphanage, school and tertiary college. During this visit I came to better understand the detainees experiences of camp life and how the camp and its facilities including tertiary college was operated and managed. I also spent time at a school near Mae Sot, Hway Ka Loke (HKL), which is a boarding school and orphanage for Karen refugees. Upon my return to Australia I successfully secured funding for HKL School which was utilised to pay for building materials to repair the orphanage and boarders sleeping rooms.', 'title': 'International Volunteer - Refugee Camp on Thai/Burma Border', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 8828130, 'name': 'Priceline', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQESwrdBV292EQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519893695954?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=CCfyU-Xs8RpV-92IgYWPBr7_xolLKPWdMU1uyAZiuyU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/priceline/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Melbourne, Australia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'Priceline', 'description': 'Priceline is a health and beauty retailer. 

Supervising staff, ordering stock, undertaking stock take and audits, collating, calculating and updating sales figures and budget targets, opening and closing the store, handling staff and customer complaints, providing cosmetic advice. Whilst in this role, I was also the OH&S Representative for a network of five (5) stores.', 'title': 'Supervisor', 'employment_type': None}]}]
